story.text: NEW YORK Jan 2 Freddie Mac FRE.N, the No. 2 U.S. home funding company, on Tuesday said it will skip issuing reference REMICs (Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit securities) in January. In its quarterly funding announcement on Dec. 20, the agency said it plans to issue at least one, but not more than three reference REMIC offerings in the first quarter of 2007. Freddie Mac's 2007 debt calendar designates monthly issuance weeks that it can opt to use for new reference REMIC offerings.
story.title: freddie mac will not issue remic in january
